algorithm_technique: Iterate through text, count occurrences of pattern[0] and pattern[1]. Add pattern[0] before pattern[1] to maximize subsequences.
problem_summary_simple: Find the best place to insert one character from a two-character pattern into a string to maximize pattern occurrences.
problem_summary_technical: Greedy approach: iterate through text, maintain counts of pattern[0] and pattern[1]. Maximize subsequences by considering insertions at optimal positions.
key_insights: The problem can be solved greedily by considering the contribution of each character in the text.
The maximum number of subsequences is achieved by strategically placing the inserted character.
The solution efficiently counts potential subsequences without explicit string manipulation.
